intro: Phaseolus glaber, commonly known as the naked-seed bean, is a legume native to the Americas. It is characterized by its smooth, glabrous pods and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in warm, temperate climates. Its seeds are edible and have been used in traditional cuisines. The species is also valued for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, benefiting agricultural practices.
